@DChen

No it won't work since no one gets priority during an anyone's untap step even says so in the rulings that having multiple activated quests are redundant.

3/1/2010 Controlling more than one Quest for Renewal with four or more quest counters on it is redundant. You can't untap your permanents more than once in a single untap step.

posts.post_content:
@Notoriety: Add [Opalescence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opalescence) to the mix and your combo'll work :P  
  
Anyways, great card. Giving your creatures pseudo-vigilance is pretty much always a good thing and I swear I'll one day build a deck abusing the hell out of this one ^^  
A variety of stuff that prevents untapping as normal, like [Stoic Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoic Angel), [Static Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Static Orb) or my favorite: [Storage Matrix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storage Matrix) should work well with it, letting you pass around their effects without much difference while keeping your opponent on the back foot with only a few untapped permanents while you wreak havoc like nothing's stopping you.  
Stuff with tap effects, pingers, card-drawers, mana-elves and what not also work wonders with it, as well as stuff that requires you to tap your creatures, like [Shared Discovery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shared Discovery) and [Opposition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opposition), which both have already been mentioned. And lastly, it also gets better the more players there are, making it b... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
